data.text:
@Jonatha38887029 Nope...have asked for internal review and timescale.

Is this something Confed could ask its members?
@LawrenceDunhill Did NHS Eng give an indication of when they'd publish?
@LawrenceDunhill Maybe government too often found that publication embarrassing?

@JasonWRDorsett @georgebatchelor @NHSProviders @sallygainsbury I will ask NHSP tomorrow if they're up for collecting the numbers.

If not maybe we each take a region!
@JasonWRDorsett @georgebatchelor @LawrenceDunhill @NHSProviders Iâ€™m in. I wonder if we could get Q4 2021/22 out before NHSE publish Q3 2019/20?

@georgebatchelor @LawrenceDunhill @NHSProviders @sallygainsbury I'm serious. We could do this. Tbh the analysis would probably be meaningful with a representative sample of providers. You could do the maths on that @georgebatchelor couldn't you?
@LawrenceDunhill Worked on NHS finances for >1 year at the wonderful NHS Providers and never got to enjoy one of these reports (at least, not an up-to-date version)!
@JasonWRDorsett @LawrenceDunhill @NHSProviders @sallygainsbury Massive opportunity to do something interesting
